<strong style="display: block;">A firm estimates that if bankruptcy occurs next year, it will incur legal and administrative costs of $20 million. The probability of bankruptcy is 30%, and the discount rate is 10%. What is the expected present value of bankruptcy costs?</strong>

<label><input type="radio" name="module9_mcq_q89" value="B"> B. $5.0 million</label><br>
<label><input type="radio" name="module9_mcq_q89" value="C"> C. $5.45 million</label><br>
<label><input type="radio" name="module9_mcq_q89" value="D"> D. $6.0 million</label><br>
<label><input type="radio" name="module9_mcq_q89" value="E"> E. $7.0 million</label><br>
</form>

<div id="feedback-module9_mcq_q89" class="feedback" data-status="" style="display:none;">
✅ C is correct. Expected cost = 0.3 × 20 = 6; discounted one year at 10% → 6 / 1.10 = $5.45 million.  
This is the PV of expected bankruptcy losses considered in trade-off theory.
